Posts.Title: Weird side effects that no one tells you about!

Posts.Content: Hello, I have IDC too and had FEC-T from Nov to March. I usually felt rubbish the 1st week after chemo and then better the following 2 weeks. The more water you can drink, the better. It really helped me in the 1st few days. Hot flushes are quite strange, aren't they?! The only thing I could do was take the covers off and put them back on. My hair fell out after about 10 days, unfortunately there was not much I could do so I had it shaved by the hairdresser who also helped me choose a wig straight away. I am now 2 months post chemo and I go out without my wig. My hair is very short but I was amazed how fast it started growing as soon as FEC was finished. Good luck, it's not a walk in the park but it's got to be done! Xxx

It made me think that however uncertain the future is and whichever cancer we have, if things were to go wrong again, there will hopefully be new improved treatments available by the time we get to that stage.
